alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 10:13PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 215 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by excessive rainfall are occurring. * WHERE...Chocolay River near Harvey. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water begins to inundate the parking lot where M-28 crosses the Chocolay River...as well as low lying areas along Timber Lane and towards the mouth of the river * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.5 feet Monday evening. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
